instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.C1950: What is C1950? Capacitor between PP3V42_G3H & ground on pin 8 of U1950 on 2013-2015 Macbook Pros & Airs that often corrodes. When corroded, pin 8 on U1950 will be damaged, which will prevent machine from booting and cause PM_SLP_S4_L to pulse. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.

threads.title: Macbook Air (13", 2017) - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Freezing after login.
threads.message:
Hi. Need help with this Macbook air please. 
It had liquid damaged around <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>. So I had to replace <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, <CAPACITOR>C1950</CAPACITOR>, and a few resister around <RESISTOR>R1963</RESISTOR>. After replace and U.S cleaning the board. It back to life. 
Worked for a week and than died again, but completely as it still turn on and login to the system. Sometimes stay 1 hours working before freeze and restart. 
Aslo I notice that it won't turn on just on charger. It needs the battery connected to turn on, but it is charging.

threads.title: Macbook Air (13", 2017) - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Freezing after login.
threads.message: This is the crash report after boot to the system.

threads.title: Macbook Air (13", 2017) - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Freezing after login.
threads.message:
BAT AND CHARGER CONNECTED
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 8.58V
<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_RED</SIGNAL> - 8.59V

Only BAT CONNECTED
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 8.34V
<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_RED</SIGNAL> - 8.35V

threads.title: Macbook Air (13", 2017) - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Freezing after login.
threads.message:
For the kernel panic, try another SSD installation.
You can also test with USB macOS.

With only charger connected, check <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> level.
<SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS present?
Be sure to use original Magsafe 2 charger.

threads.title: Macbook Air (13", 2017) - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Freezing after login.
threads.message:
I've tried another SSD and same. 
Will try external ssd system tomorrow and post all other questions you've asked.

threads.title: Macbook Air (13", 2017) - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Freezing after login.
threads.message:
I was using MagSafe 1 with adapter and no voltage on <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>. After use original MagSafe 2 it started to get 3.30V

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS is present
<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> - 3.30V with no battery

I gonna run test again over an External SSD system.

threads.title: Macbook Air (13", 2017) - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Freezing after login.
threads.message:
"I was using MagSafe 1 with adapter"
STOP doing that and avoid future problems.
